headline: Blue Elephant signs 319MW solar PV PPAs with German railway operator
summary_80w: German renewables developer Blue Elephant Energy has signed two long-term power purchase agreements (PPA) with the German railway network operator Deutsche Bahn for utility-scale solar power projects.

headline: 1.6GWh Melbourne Renewable Energy Hub battery storage system brought online in Australia
summary_80w: The 600MW/1.6GWh Melbourne Renewable Energy Hub has commenced commercial operations in Victoria, Australia.

headline: NEM data spotlight: Record generation meets wild price swings in Australia’s NEM in November
summary_80w: Rooftop solar PV generated nearly twice the output of utility-scale solar throughout November 2025, maintaining a 1.9:1 ratio in Australia.

headline: Waaree inks 288MW US supply deal for ‘high resilience’ bifacial modules
summary_80w: Indian solar PV manufacturer Waaree Energies has signed a 288MWp solar module supply deal with US project developer Sabanci Renewables.

headline: Equinor starts operations at its first hybrid solar-plus-wind project
summary_80w: Equinor has started commercial operations at its first hybrid solar-plus-wind project in the Brazilian state of Bahia.

headline: Tongwei Global Partner Summit 2025: Arctic protection, digital manufacturing and TNC 3.0 Modules
summary_80w: Tongwei used its Global Partner Summit to show how high-efficiency PV, digital manufacturing and biodiversity protection must advance together.

headline: ACWA Power, Bapco Energies to build 2.8GW solar-plus-storage project in Saudi Arabia
summary_80w: ACWA Power and Bapco Energies have signed an agreement to build a 2.8GW solar plant in Saudi Arabia, to be co-located with a BESS.

headline: ROUNDUP: Energy Vault enters Switzerland, ZincFive raises funds, Convergent closes on NYC financing
summary_80w: In this Energy-Storage.news roundup, Energy Vault enters the Swiss energy storage market, ZincFive raises Series F financing, and Convergent Energy and Power secures a multimillion-dollar facility provided by NY Green Bank.

headline: UK: ‘Painful but necessary’ reforms see 153GW of battery storage projects cut from grid connection queue
summary_80w: The UK’s National Energy System Operator (NESO) will offer grid connection offers up to 2035 to 283GW of projects following a reform of the process.

headline: Long-duration energy storage is non-negotiable for Europe’s energy transformation
summary_80w: European energy independence is achievable if long-duration energy storage is factored into the mix, writes Oonagh O'Grady of Hydrostor.

headline: Vena Energy signs BESS agreement with CATL for Indonesia-Singapore ‘renewable energy corridor’
summary_80w: Vena Energy has signed a battery storage supply agreement with CATL for a project which would export renewable energy from Indonesia to Singapore.

headline: Western Australia’s 500MWh vanadium flow battery initiative is a ‘pivotal moment’
summary_80w: A Western Australian government initiative to deploy the largest vanadium redox flow battery (VRFB) project outside China is a “pivotal moment,” one technology provider has said.

headline: Colombia launches solar PV arm, targets 650MW portfolio
summary_80w: The Colombian government has created Gecelca Solar, a solar PV-focused arm of its public utility company Gecelca.

headline: Scatec signs deals for 1.1GW Egypt solar project, powers up South Africa PV site
summary_80w: Norwegian renewable energy firm Scatec has signed equity deals for a massive solar-plus-storage project in Egypt and begun operations at a site in South Africa.

headline: Preventing PV connector problems before they start
summary_80w: Proper training and adherence to best field practices are necessary to halt the steady trend of PV connector failures resulting from poor workmanship, write Brian Mills and Grayson Maurer.

headline: Alight commissions 215MW agrivoltaics project in Denmark
summary_80w: Swedish independent power producer (IPP) Alight Energy has commissioned a 215MW agrivoltaics project in Denmark.

headline: Zelestra to sell 3.5GW Latin America renewables platform to focus on Europe and US
summary_80w: Spanish IPP Zelestra has signed an agreement to sell its 3.5GW Latin America renewables platform to Colombian natural gas firm Promigas.

headline: Arizona county supervisors approve 400MWh BESS project near site of 2019 Surprise fire
summary_80w: Supervisors in Maricopa County, Arizona, have approved a 100MW/400MWh battery storage project from National Renewable Solutions (NRS).

headline: Desert Mountain Energy plans sodium nickel chloride battery factory in New Mexico
summary_80w: Vancouver-based helium and natural gas producer Desert Mountain Energy (DME) has signed a non-binding letter of intent (LOI) to form a joint venture (JV) to build and operate a sodium nickel chloride (SNC) battery manufacturing facility in Roswell, New Mexico.

headline: Angola: Energy minister inaugurates first solar-plus-storage minigrid in national rollout
summary_80w: The first of 46 solar minigrids planned in Angola has been inaugurated by João Baptista Borges, the African country’s Minister of Energy and Water.

headline: Vena Energy builds 408MWh BESS at third phase of South Australia renewable energy project
summary_80w: Vena Energy has commenced construction of a large-scale standalone battery energy storage system (BESS), adjacent to two of the company’s existing facilities, in South Australia.

headline: Origis secures finance from Advantage Capital for 305MW US solar PV portfolio
summary_80w: Origis Energy has raised US$265 million in finance from Advantage Capital to support the development of a 305MW solar PV portfolio in the US.

headline: WBS Power sells German solar-plus-storage project
summary_80w: WBS Power has sold the 150MW solar, 500MW/2,000MWh BESS Project Jupiter in Brandenburg, Germany, to investor Prime Capital.

headline: BayWa r.e. sells 89MW UK solar portfolio to Capital Dynamics
summary_80w: BayWa r.e. has sold two of its UK solar farms, which have a combined capacity of 89.9MW, to global asset management firm Capital Dynamics

headline: US Solar industry demands end to DOI’s ‘unequal’ PV permitting pause
summary_80w: Over 140 US solar companies have urged Congress to reconsider changes to permitting which they say have resulted in “a nearly complete moratorium” on solar project permits.

headline: Overcoming Xcel Energy’s ‘hostile’ approach to renewable energy in Colorado
summary_80w: In November, the Colorado PUC ordered utility Xcel Energy to provide higher-quality information, and introduce flexible tariffs.

headline: BrightNight and Cordelio close on 800MWh Washington state BESS
summary_80w: Developer BrightNight and independent power producer (IPP) Cordelio Power have announced financial close of the 200MW/800MWh Greenwater battery energy storage system (BESS) in Washington state, US.

headline: ADS-TEC battery-buffered EV fast chargers put into ancillary services market in Austria
summary_80w: Project to integrate electric vehicle fast-chargers into ancillary services markets could be widely replicated, according to ADS-TEC Energy.

headline: Australia’s grid-forming battery storage pipeline extends to nearly a hundred projects, says AEMO
summary_80w: Battery energy storage systems (BESS) equipped with grid-forming inverters have emerged as essential components for maintaining system stability in Australia’s National Electricity Market (NEM) as renewable energy penetration increases.

headline: Germany Roundup: 500MW BESS and data centre transaction, seven-year toll and 370MW pipeline secured
summary_80w: A trio of Germany grid-scale BESS news items, with Next Kraftwerke and ju:niz Energy agreeing a seven year toll, Alpiq announcing a 370MW pipeline, and WBS Power selling the country's largest solar-plus-storage project and planning a data centre on the same site.

headline: Zenith locks in 25-year PPA for 300MWh hybrid storage project at Western Australia gold mine
summary_80w: Zenith secures 25-year PPA with Northern Star for 532MW hybrid project featuring a 138MW/300MWh BESS at Kalgoorlie gold mine in Australia.

headline: PV self-consumption on ‘significant’ rise in Germany – Fraunhofer
summary_80w: High power prices and increased energy storage usage have led to a sharp increase in self-consumption of solar power in Germany since 2022, according to data from the Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy Systems (ISE).

headline: Italy awards 7.69GW of solar PV capacity in FER X auction
summary_80w: The Italian government has granted awards to 474 solar PV projects, with a combined capacity of 7.698GW, under the FER X programme.

headline: LONGi enters energy storage market, redefining industry standards with “ultimate safety”
summary_80w: LONGi unveiled its energy storage strategy in London last week, officially announcing its entry into the storage sector with the launch of the LONGi Energy Storage One-Stop Solution.

headline: Quality, traceability and AI: PV ModuleTech Europe’s key takeaways
summary_80w: Module quality issues, such as glass breakage, UVID and delamination, featured heavily in the discussions at PV ModuleTech Europe this week.

headline: Nextpower to double steel tracker manufacturing capacity in Tennessee
summary_80w: Nextpower, formerly Nextracker, will double its steel solar tracker manufacturing capacity in Tennessee and has established a new “regional hub” in the Southeast US.

headline: Australia generates over 5,000GWh of electricity from renewables in November 2025
summary_80w: Australia generated 5,271GWh of utility-scale solar PV and wind power in November 2025, a 28% increase from the same period last year.

headline: RWE commissions Texas solar-plus-storage project
summary_80w: RWE Clean Energy has commissioned the Stoneridge Solar PV project in Texas, adding 200MW of solar PV and 100MW/200MWh BESS to its operational portfolio.

headline: Indiana utility to deliver 1.6GWh BESS for Amazon’s data center expansion, though fossil fuels form major part of package
summary_80w: A subsidiary of utility Northern Indiana Public Service Company (NIPSCO) has struck a deal with Amazon to construct 3GW of new dispatchable capacity, with the aim of serving the tech company’s planned data center expansion.

headline: PJM awards interconnection agreements to 23 BESS resources
summary_80w: PJM has awarded 23 battery energy storage system (BESS) resources, totalling 2.2GW, with interconnection agreements (IAs) in its first transition cycle (TC1) of the reformed interconnection process.

headline: Eight energy trends that will shape Australian energy storage in 2026
summary_80w: Jason Beer of Fluence Australia, discusses some energy trends in Australia that are set to influence the development of the storage market.

headline: ARENA commits US$98 million to Sunman’s 500MW PV module manufacturing hub in Australia
summary_80w: The Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) has announced up to AU$151 million (US$98 million) in conditional funding for Sunman Energy to establish a 500MW per annum solar module manufacturing facility in the Hunter Valley, New South Wales (NSW).

headline: Ontario municipality denies support for 3.2GWh BESS project ahead of looming IESO RFP deadline
summary_80w: The Municipality of Shuniah in Ontario, Canada, voted against supporting a 400MW/3.2GWh long-duration energy storage project proposed by PowerBank.

headline: State-owned Stanwell bags exclusivity for Quinbrook’s 6.24GWh hybrid energy storage facility in Australia
summary_80w: Stanwell bags rights to Quinbrook's 6.24GWh Gladstone Energy Hub, combining 780MW battery energy storage with gas generation in Queensland.

headline: ADB to provide US$650 million loan to accelerate Indian rooftop solar deployment
summary_80w: The Asian Development Bank has approved a US$650 million loan to accelerate rooftop solar PV deployment in India.

headline: Fraunhofer ISE tests medium voltage solar components to reduce costs and materials
summary_80w: German research institute Fraunhofer ISE has launched a project to explore how medium-voltage technology can make material-intensive solar components more efficient and cost-effective.

headline: Terra-Gen closes financing for 205MW Lockhart III & IV solar project in California
summary_80w: Terra-Gen has closed financing for its 205MW Lockhart III & IV solar PV project in San Bernadino County, California.

headline: Buyers should exercise ‘caution’ as solar component prices rise, says Intertek CEA
summary_80w: Buyers should prepare for increases in the price of vital solar module components, such as polysilicon, wafers and cells, but “remain cautious” of accepting new contractual terms from Chinese suppliers until formal market policies are agreed.

headline: ‘Renewable energy’ stripped from NREL’s name in shift of priorities
summary_80w: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has renamed the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) the National Laboratory of the Rockies.

headline: ABB acquires Gamesa Electric power electronics division for undisclosed sum
summary_80w: ABB has acquired the solar PV and wind inverter and battery storage power conversion system (PCS) businesses of Gamesa Electric.

headline: Cache Power plans ‘Canada’s first’ commercial-scale compressed air energy storage facility
summary_80w: Compressed air energy storage (CAES) developer Cache Power is partnering with construction company EllisDon to deliver a CAES facility in Northeast Alberta, Canada.

headline: Are battery companies focusing on lithium-ion alternatives financially viable?
summary_80w: Solar Media analyst Charlotte Gisbourne assesses the outlook for the major listed non-lithium battery energy storage technology companies.

headline: VIDEO: Powering certainty with Elementa 2 Pro, bankable energy storage from Trina
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with Trina Storage, 'Powering Certainty: Bankable Energy Storage, with Elementa 2 Pro'.

headline: FRV and AGL advance 2,200MWh of grid-forming battery energy storage in Australia
summary_80w: Two battery storage system developments from FRV Australia and AGL Energy, totalling 2,200MWh, have reached major milestones in Australia.

headline: World Bank supports multi-gigawatt cross-border renewable energy project in Malaysia
summary_80w: The World Bank will invest in a huge 4GW, 5.12GWh solar-plus-storage complex in Malaysia, part of a pan-Southeast Asian power grid initiative.

headline: Aypa Power to build, own, and operate 1,200MWh South Carolina BESS
summary_80w: South Carolina public utility company Santee Cooper has applied for a Certificate of Environmental Compatibility and Public Convenience and Neccessity (CECPCN) with the state’s public service commission (PSC), for its 300MW/1,200MWh battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: Sunsure Energy signs PPA for 82.5MW Indian solar project
summary_80w: Sunsure Energy has signed a long-term power purchase agreement (PPA) with Indian drinking water brand Bisleri International.

headline: ABB completes acquisition of Gamesa Electric
summary_80w: Swiss electrification specialist ABB has acquired solar PV inverter and power conversion system (PCS) producer Gamesa Electric for an undisclosed sum.

headline: Astronergy, JA Solar to ‘terminate’ patent disputes, reach cross-licencing agreement
summary_80w: Astronergy and JA Solar have 'reached an agreement on cross-licencing' of tunnel oxide passivated contact (TOPCon) patents moving forward.

headline: AEMO charts Australia’s rooftop solar boom to 42.5GW by 2036
summary_80w: Australia's NEM faces a fundamental transformation as solar PV generation and BESS drive the transition to a low-emissions energy system.

headline: Voltage Energy on the implementation of virtual reality and the advantages of aluminum in the EBOS field
summary_80w: PV Tech sat down with Voltage Energy’s CEO, Li Wang, and discussed the advantages of aluminium and the use of virtual reality in the eBOS field.

headline: US battery manufacturing ‘could cover domestic BESS demand within a few years’
summary_80w: Shifting dynamics in the US' BESS industry could mean that Chinese batteries are not even needed within the foreseeable future, a local consultant told Energy-Storage.news.

headline: Puerto Rico advances on its delayed accelerated BESS deployment programme
summary_80w: The Puerto Rico Energy Bureau (PREB) has issued a resolution and order requiring the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority (PREPA) to complete the Accelerated Battery Energy Storage Addition Programme (ASAP).

headline: HDRE, Brawn Capital put ‘100% merchant’ BESS into operation in northern Japan
summary_80w: Manoa Energy and HD Renewable Energy Japan have begun commercial operation of a 50MW/104MWh battery storage project in Hokkaido, Japan.

headline: Australia: 212,000 PV modules installed at 119MW state-owned solar-plus-storage site
summary_80w: Victoria's first state-owned solar-plus-storage project has reached a major construction milestone, with the installation of all 212,296 PV modules at the SEC Renewable Energy Park in Horsham, Australia.

headline: Canadian Solar shifts US solar, energy storage manufacturing assets to North American ownership
summary_80w: Multinational solar manufacturer Canadian Solar will assume direct control of its US solar PV and energy storage manufacturing operations, in a strategic move which may reduce its supply chain risks.

headline: Midsummer to ship up to 200MW of equipment to Colombian CIGS solar factory
summary_80w: Swedish thin-film solar manufacturer Midsummer will ship up to 200MW worth of manufacturing equipment to a planned thin-film solar PV manufacturing facility in Colombia.

headline: Grenergy sells 88MW Colombian solar PV portfolio
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Grenergy has agreed to sell an 88MW solar PV portfolio of projects in Colombia.

headline: India to increase solar PV module efficiency threshold in ALMM
summary_80w: The Indian Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has requested comments on the proposal to increase the solar PV module efficiency of the Approved List of Models and Manufacturers (ALMM).

headline: Navigating the challenges of TOPCon: insights from the frontline
summary_80w: Steven Xuereb of Kiwa PI Berlin discusses the PV industry’s progress in addressing performance and reliability concerns around TOPCon technology.

headline: Fortescue deploys 250MWh BYD battery system in Western Australia
summary_80w: Fortescue has completed delivery of its first large-scale battery storage system (BESS) to the North Star Junction site in Western Australia.

headline: ‘Italy is a natural market for batteries’: Greenvolt Power on its MACSE-winning project
summary_80w: We caught up with developer and IPP Greenvolt Power's head of storage Antonio Montoto Rojo about the recent MACSE auction in Italy, where it won a contract for a 75MW BESS.

headline: Skeleton Tech begins manufacturing high-power solutions to AI boom in Europe
summary_80w: Estonia-headquartered high-power energy storage startup Skeleton Technologies officially opened two European production plants in November.

headline: Multiple gigawatts of European BESS project M&A, financing and route-to-market deals
summary_80w: European BESS news from project owners Premier Energy Group, Verbund, Eco Stor, Ingrid Capacity, Ric Energy, Ganfeng Lithium, EP Group, RWE and Giga Storage, securing acquisitions, financings and route-to-market (RTM) deals for multiple gigawatts of capacity this past week.

headline: 600MWh Bulabul battery storage site in Australia attracts Danish partner in AU$300 million deal
summary_80w: Ampyr Australia has secured a 15-year battery storage agreement with InCommodities for the 600MWh Bulabul BESS in New South Wales.

headline: EBRD finances 531MW Romanian PV portfolio
summary_80w: The EBRD will invest in a 531MW solar PV portfolio in Romania from Israeli renewables company Nofar Energy.

headline: European Patent Office revokes JA Solar multi-busbar PV patent in ‘good news’ for EU manufacturers
summary_80w: The European Patent Office (EPO) has revoked a patent for a key solar cell manufacturing process, which has been hailed as “good news” for European solar PV manufacturing.

headline: LONGi acquires PotisEdge, to deploy ‘one-stop’ energy storage solution
summary_80w: LONGi has acquired system integrator PotisEdge, and plans to launch an ‘Energy Storage One-Stop Solution’.

headline: Huasun launches 760W HJT module with 2,000 V system voltage
summary_80w: Chinese module manufacturer Huasun Energy has launched a new heterojunction module with a 760 W output, a 2,000 V system voltage and 24.5% module efficiency.

headline: Battery storage fire safety: Sungrow, Wärtsilä, Chint Power products put through LSFT
summary_80w: Battery storage products from prominent international providers Sungrow, Wärtsilä and Chint Power have undergone recent fire safety tests.

headline: Australia opens Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 8, seeking 16GWh of energy storage across NEM
summary_80w: The Australian government has officially opened CIS Tender 8, targeting 16GWh of energy storage capacity across the NEM.

headline: Michigan Township enacts one-year BESS moratorium after greenfield developer sizes up area for utility-scale project
summary_80w: The Township Board of Oshtemo in Michigan has voted in favour of enacting a one-year moratorium on the approval of any new BESS facilities.

headline: UBS upgrades China BESS installation forecast, industry to ride policy tailwinds
summary_80w: With Document No. 136 scrapping the mandatory energy storage allocation requirement for renewable energy and the rollout of policies governing new energy storage, China's energy storage market is going through a period of dynamic change.

headline: How to build a solar-plus-storage project on a US Superfund site
summary_80w: Prateek Tare tells PV Tech Premium how Distributed Energy Infrastructure transformed a Superfund site into the Acton PV-plus-storage project.

headline: 4GW/5.12GWh Malaysia solar-plus-storage hub receives World Bank funding
summary_80w: The World Bank will invest in a huge 4GW, 5.12GWh solar-plus-storage complex in Malaysia, which will form part of a pan-Southeast Asian power grid initiative.

headline: Romanian TSO Transelectrica publishes new grid allocation rules for 2026
summary_80w: Transelectrica has published new rules for the Romanian grid, setting out time frames for auctions involving new energy generation projects.

headline: Solar Stewardship Initiative to establish copper supply assurance scheme
summary_80w: The Solar Stewardship Initiative (SSI) and the Copper Mark have signed an agreement to pursue “responsible production and sourcing of copper across the solar energy value chain”.

headline: RWE commissions 200MW, 100MW/200MWh solar-plus-storage project in Texas
summary_80w: RWE Clean Energy has commissioned the 200MW Stoneridge Solar PV project in Texas, which is co-located with a 100MW/200MWh BESS.

headline: CPUC urged to hold PG&E and SCE ‘to account’ for solar interconnection delays
summary_80w: A group of California legislators has called on the state Public Utilities Commission to hold two utilities accountable for delays in connecting solar PV and energy storage capacity to the grid.

headline: Brookfield enters Thailand and the Philippines markets with Alba Renewables acquisition
summary_80w: Global investment firm Brookfield Asset Management has acquired Singapore-headquartered independent power producer (IPP) Alba Renewables.

headline: Nostromo’s thermal ESS participates in CAISO energy market
summary_80w: Nostromo Energy's IceBrick thermal energy storage (TES) technology will participate in the California Independent System Operator (CAISO) wholesale energy market.

headline: Eos completes financing transactions totalling over US$1 billion, focuses on US manufacturing
summary_80w: US zinc battery storage manufacturer Eos Energy Enterprises has completed two financing transactions totalling over US$1 billion to strengthen its financial position and fund expansion.

headline: EDF joint venture kicks off large-scale BESS and solar-plus-storage projects in Chile
summary_80w: A joint venture (JV) between EDF and developer AME has begun construction of large-scale battery and solar photovoltaic (PV) projects in Chile, with 2GWh storage capacity.

headline: Italian battery storage market pipeline soars, developers flock from around Europe
summary_80w: The utility-scale battery storage market in Italy is drawing huge interest and development activity, writes Solar Media Market Research analyst Josh Cornes.

headline: Western Australia seeks local vanadium for 500MWh Kalgoorlie battery storage project
summary_80w: The Western Australian government has launched the first stage of an Expression of Interest (EOI) process for a 50MW/500MWh vanadium flow battery energy storage system (VBESS) in Kalgoorlie.

headline: ‘It’s effectively a full reset of the system’: Habitat Energy on ERCOT’s RTC+B market changes
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Michael Kirschner, Managing Director, US, for Habitat Energy, about optimising BESS projects in ERCOT.

headline: Liquid air energy storage startup Highview breaks ground at 300MWh UK project
summary_80w: Mayor of Greater Manchester Andy Burnham marked the commencement of construction at Highview's 300MWh liquid air energy storage facility.

headline: Fluence ‘expects to meet FEOC compliance by regulatory deadlines,’ offers 2026 guidance
summary_80w: The US market is expected to be the largest source of revenue and driver of activity for Fluence in 2026, and a second battery cell deal with a domestic supplier is imminent.

headline: 250MWh ‘Sand Battery’ to start construction in Finland, for both heating and ancillary services
summary_80w: Technology provider Polar Night Energy and utility Lahti Energia have partnered for a large-scale project using Polar's 'Sand Battery' technology for the latter's district heating network in Vääksy, Finland.

headline: ‘Rapid growth but disorderly competiton’: Longi enters energy storage industry with PotisEdge deal
summary_80w: We caught up with the president of system integrator PotisEdge following news of its acquisition by Longi, which marks the Chinese solar PV giant's move into the energy storage industry.
